a:5:{s:1:"d";a:3:{i:0;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7549";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:40:"oil-and-gas-strategic-pricing-in-myanmar";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:40:"Oil and Gas Strategic Pricing in Myanmar";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-05-16";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"5";s:7:"content";s:3381:"<p style="text-align: justify;">As Myanmar&rsquo;s crude oil production has been far too limited to meet domestic petroleum demand, it has had to rely mostly on importing petroleum products, mainly from Singapore. If Myanmar constructs a refinery, Myanmar&rsquo;s petroleum market will have two types of petroleum products &ndash;domestic and import. So it will need a petroleum pricing system to integrate the domestic and import prices.&nbsp;Myanmar&#039;s gas production is forecast to decline in the years ahead.&nbsp;&nbsp;Hence, Myanmar will need to import gas, especially liquid natural gas (LNG) for internal use, i.e. for power generation and industrial activities. Myanmar, therefore, will need a unique gas pricing system to reflect domestic and imported gases. This report seeks to provide Myanmar with suggestions for formulating new oil and gas pricing systems.</p><h2>Full Report</h2><p class="pdf" style="text-align: justify;"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/Oil-and-Gas-Strategic-Pricing-in-Myanmar.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Oil and Gas Strategic Pricing in Myanmar</a></p><h2>&nbsp;</h2><h2>Contents</h2><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/01_Title-Page.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Title Page</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/02_Preface-and-Acknowledgement.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Preface and Acknowledgement</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/03_List-of-Project-Members.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">List of Project Members</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/04_Contents.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Contents</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/05_List-of-Figures-and-Tables.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">List of Figures and Tables</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/06_List-of-Abbreviations-and-Acronyms.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">List of Abbreviations and Acronyms</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/07_Executive-Summary.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Executive Summary</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/08_Chapter-1-Introduction.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chapter 1 Introduction</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/09_Chapter-2-Oil-Strategic-Pricing-in-Myanmar.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chapter 2 Oil Strategic Pricing in Myanmar</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/10_Chapter-3-Strategic-Gas-Pricing-in-Myanmar.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chapter 3 Strategic Gas Pricing in Myanmar</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/11_Chapter-4-Conclusion-and-Recommendations.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Chapter 4 Conclusion and Recommendations</a></p><p class="pdf"><a href="/uploads/media/Research-Project-Report/RPR-2023-02/12_References.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">References</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:103:"/uploads/publications/20230516/rpr-2023---oil-and-gas-strategic-pricing-in-myanmar--website-cover-1.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:18:"Energy,Oil,Myanmar";s:6:"editor";s:74:"Shigeru Kimura,Takahisa Hiruma,Hiroshi Hashimoto,Citra Endah Nur Setyawati";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:11:"RPR-2023-02";s:6:"period";s:4:"2023";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:7:"Myanmar";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2023-05-16";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:2955:"Oil and Gas Strategic Pricing in Myanmar Oil and Gas Strategic Pricing in Myanmar As Myanmar&rsquo;s crude oil production has been far too limited to meet domestic petroleum demand, it has had to rely mostly on importing petroleum products, mainly from Singapore. If Myanmar constructs a refinery, Myanmar&rsquo;s petroleum market will have two types of petroleum products &ndash;domestic and import. So it will need a petroleum pricing system to integrate the domestic and import prices.&nbsp;Myanmar's gas production is forecast to decline in the years ahead.&nbsp;&nbsp;Hence, Myanmar will need to import gas, especially liquid natural gas (LNG) for internal use, i.e. for power generation and industrial activities. Myanmar, therefore, will need a unique gas pricing system to reflect domestic and imported gases. This report seeks to provide Myanmar with suggestions for formulating new oil and gas pricing systems.
Full Report
Oil and Gas Strategic Pricing in Myanmar

ramnayM ni gnicirP saG cigetartS 3 retpahC
ramnayM ni gnicirP cigetartS liO 2 retpahC
noitcudortnI 1 retpahC

smynorcA dna snoitaiverbbA fo tsiL
selbaT dna serugiF fo tsiL
stnetnoC
srebmeM tcejorP fo tsiL
tnemegdelwonkcA dna ecaferP
egaP eltiT

;psbn&
ramnayM ni gnicirP cigetartS saG dna liO
tropeR lluF
.smetsys gnicirp sag dna lio wen gnitalumrof rof snoitseggus htiw ramnayM edivorp ot skees troper sihT .sesag detropmi dna citsemod tcelfer ot metsys gnicirp sag euqinu a deen lliw ,erofereht ,ramnayM .seitivitca lairtsudni dna noitareneg rewop rof .e.i ,esu lanretni rof )GNL( sag larutan diuqil yllaicepse ,sag tropmi ot deen lliw ramnayM ,ecneH;psbn&;psbn&.daeha sraey eht ni enilced ot tsacerof si noitcudorp sag s'ramnayM;psbn&.secirp tropmi dna citsemod eht etargetni ot metsys gnicirp muelortep a deen lliw ti oS .tropmi dna citsemod;hsadn& stcudorp muelortep fo sepyt owt evah lliw tekram muelortep s;ouqsr&ramnayM ,yrenifer a stcurtsnoc ramnayM fI .eropagniS morf ylniam ,stcudorp muelortep gnitropmi no yltsom yler ot dah sah ti ,dnamed muelortep citsemod teem ot detimil oot raf neeb sah noitcudorp lio edurc s;ouqsr&ramnayM sA ramnayM ni gnicirP cigetartS saG dna liO ramnayM ni gnicirP cigetartS saG dna liO";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-05-16 15:23:23";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-05-16 15:40:11";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"20";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}i:1;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7545";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:77:"does-the-skill-premium-influence-educational-decisions-evidence-from-viet-nam";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:79:"Does the Skill Premium Influence Educational Decisions?  Evidence from Viet Nam";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-05-15";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"5";s:7:"content";s:1462:"<p>Viet Nam&rsquo;s economy has grown and changed in dramatic ways since WTO accession in 2007. Much of the growth and change is due to expanded international trade and FDI. These in turn have greatly increased domestic labour demand. However, growth that exploits the country&rsquo;s abundant supply of low-skill labour may depress the relative demand for skills. In this paper we ask whether the skill premium &ndash; the relative price of skills, which also measures the gross economic benefit to schooling at high school and beyond &ndash; plays an influential role in schooling decisions amongst teenagers for whom wage-work is an alternative to continued education. We first use event study methods to clarify trends in wages and skill premia. We then decompose influences on upper secondary school enrolments from income growth, demographic change, and skill premia. We find that the college skill premium has a positive influence on enrolments, whereas the premium from upper secondary completion has no significant effect. Our conclusions explore implications for future productivity growth as well as economic and educational policies.&nbsp;</p><p class="pdf"><a title="ERIA-DP-2023-03" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/discussion-papers/FY23/Does-the-Skill-Premium-Influence-Educational-Decisions-VietNam.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Does the Skill Premium Influence Educational Decisions?&nbsp; Evidence from Viet Nam</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:56:"/uploads/publications/20230515/cover-eria-dp-2023-03.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:57:"Viet Nam,Education,Skills Development,labour productivity";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:34:"Ian Coxhead,Nguyen Dinh Tuan Vuong";s:6:"doc_no";s:9:"DP-FY2023";s:6:"period";s:4:"2023";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:8:"Viet Nam";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2023-05-15";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:3103:"Does the Skill Premium Influence Educational Decisions?  Evidence from Viet Nam Does the Skill Premium Influence Educational Decisions?  Evidence from Viet Nam Viet Nam&rsquo;s economy has grown and changed in dramatic ways since WTO accession in 2007. Much of the growth and change is due to expanded international trade and FDI. These in turn have greatly increased domestic labour demand. However, growth that exploits the country&rsquo;s abundant supply of low-skill labour may depress the relative demand for skills. In this paper we ask whether the skill premium &ndash; the relative price of skills, which also measures the gross economic benefit to schooling at high school and beyond &ndash; plays an influential role in schooling decisions amongst teenagers for whom wage-work is an alternative to continued education. We first use event study methods to clarify trends in wages and skill premia. We then decompose influences on upper secondary school enrolments from income growth, demographic change, and skill premia. We find that the college skill premium has a positive influence on enrolments, whereas the premium from upper secondary completion has no significant effect. Our conclusions explore implications for future productivity growth as well as economic and educational policies.&nbsp;
Does the Skill Premium Influence Educational Decisions?&nbsp; Evidence from Viet Nam Viet Nam,Education,Skills Development,labour productivity  Ian Coxhead,Nguyen Dinh Tuan Vuong DP-FY2023 2023  Viet Nam    2023-05-15  2023-05-15 15 May 2023 3202 yaM 51 51-50-3202  51-50-3202    maN teiV  3202 3202YF-PD gnouV nauT hniD neyugN,daehxoC naI  ytivitcudorp ruobal,tnempoleveD sllikS,noitacudE,maN teiV maN teiV morf ecnedivE ;psbn&?snoisiceD lanoitacudE ecneulfnI muimerP llikS eht seoD
;psbn&.seicilop lanoitacude dna cimonoce sa llew sa htworg ytivitcudorp erutuf rof snoitacilpmi erolpxe snoisulcnoc ruO .tceffe tnacifingis on sah noitelpmoc yradnoces reppu morf muimerp eht saerehw ,stnemlorne no ecneulfni evitisop a sah muimerp lliks egelloc eht taht dnif eW .aimerp lliks dna ,egnahc cihpargomed ,htworg emocni morf stnemlorne loohcs yradnoces reppu no secneulfni esopmoced neht eW .aimerp lliks dna segaw ni sdnert yfiralc ot sdohtem yduts tneve esu tsrif eW .noitacude deunitnoc ot evitanretla na si krow-egaw mohw rof sreganeet tsgnoma snoisiced gniloohcs ni elor laitneulfni na syalp ;hsadn& dnoyeb dna loohcs hgih ta gniloohcs ot tifeneb cimonoce ssorg eht serusaem osla hcihw ,slliks fo ecirp evitaler eht ;hsadn& muimerp lliks eht rehtehw ksa ew repap siht nI .slliks rof dnamed evitaler eht sserped yam ruobal lliks-wol fo ylppus tnadnuba s;ouqsr&yrtnuoc eht stiolpxe taht htworg ,revewoH .dnamed ruobal citsemod desaercni yltaerg evah nrut ni esehT .IDF dna edart lanoitanretni dednapxe ot eud si egnahc dna htworg eht fo hcuM .7002 ni noissecca OTW ecnis syaw citamard ni degnahc dna nworg sah ymonoce s;ouqsr&maN teiV maN teiV morf ecnedivE  ?snoisiceD lanoitacudE ecneulfnI muimerP llikS eht seoD maN teiV morf ecnedivE  ?snoisiceD lanoitacudE ecneulfnI muimerP llikS eht seoD";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-05-15 14:34:10";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-05-15 14:35:30";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"5";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}i:2;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7544";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:84:"fostering-aseans-digital-future-through-cybersecurity-policies-and-human-empowerment";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"3";s:5:"title";s:87:"Fostering ASEAN’s Digital Future through Cybersecurity Policies and Human Empowerment";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-05-15";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"5";s:7:"content";s:1669:"<p>The adoption of advanced technology comes with the risk of cyberattacks. Despite the remarkable prospects of the digital economy, the cost of cyberattacks has reached millions of United States (US) dollars and is projected to increase. Investment is needed to provide cybersecurity to help secure the growth of the digital and sustainable economy and anticipate more advanced attacks. As investment in cybersecurity has started to grow in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), challenges are present in the intangible form of inexistent or strict policies, skill shortages, and insufficient public awareness, which can halt the effectiveness of such investment. This policy brief proposes three policy recommendations to ensure successful investment in cybersecurity:</p><ol><li>Ensure that cybersecurity policies and legal frameworks are not underdeveloped or overly restrictive.</li><li>Support small businesses in earning customer trust through cost-effective guidelines.</li><li>Incentivise and maintain partnerships for education, research, and capacity building with moral and ethical education for future experts.</li><li>Raise cyber hygiene and establish integrative reporting platforms that help people identify and detect cyber risk.</li></ol><p class="pdf"><a href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/policy-brief/FY2023/2023-02-Fostering-ASEAN%E2%80%99s-Digital-Future-through-Cybersecurity-Policies-and-Human-Empowerment/Fostering-ASEANs-Digital-Future-through-Cybersecurity-Policies-and-Human.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Fostering ASEAN&rsquo;s Digital Future through Cybersecurity Policies and Human Empowerment</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:65:"/uploads/publications/20230515/pb-cybersecurity-website-cover.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:46:"Cybersecurity,Technology,Digital Economy,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:22:"Michelle Chandra Kasih";s:6:"doc_no";s:7:"2023-02";s:6:"period";s:4:"2023";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:5:"asean";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2023-05-15";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:3267:"Fostering ASEAN’s Digital Future through Cybersecurity Policies and Human Empowerment Fostering ASEAN’s Digital Future through Cybersecurity Policies and Human Empowerment The adoption of advanced technology comes with the risk of cyberattacks. Despite the remarkable prospects of the digital economy, the cost of cyberattacks has reached millions of United States (US) dollars and is projected to increase. Investment is needed to provide cybersecurity to help secure the growth of the digital and sustainable economy and anticipate more advanced attacks. As investment in cybersecurity has started to grow in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), challenges are present in the intangible form of inexistent or strict policies, skill shortages, and insufficient public awareness, which can halt the effectiveness of such investment. This policy brief proposes three policy recommendations to ensure successful investment in cybersecurity:

Ensure that cybersecurity policies and legal frameworks are not underdeveloped or overly restrictive.
Support small businesses in earning customer trust through cost-effective guidelines.
Incentivise and maintain partnerships for education, research, and capacity building with moral and ethical education for future experts.
Raise cyber hygiene and establish integrative reporting platforms that help people identify and detect cyber risk.

Fostering ASEAN&rsquo;s Digital Future through Cybersecurity Policies and Human Empowerment Cybersecurity,Technology,Digital Economy,ASEAN  Michelle Chandra Kasih 2023-02 2023  asean    2023-05-15  2023-05-15 15 May 2023 3202 yaM 51 51-50-3202  51-50-3202    naesa  3202 20-3202 hisaK ardnahC ellehciM  NAESA,ymonocE latigiD,ygolonhceT,ytirucesrebyC tnemrewopmE namuH dna seiciloP ytirucesrebyC hguorht erutuF latigiD s;ouqsr&NAESA gniretsoF

.ksir rebyc tceted dna yfitnedi elpoep pleh taht smroftalp gnitroper evitargetni hsilbatse dna eneigyh rebyc esiaR
.strepxe erutuf rof noitacude lacihte dna larom htiw gnidliub yticapac dna ,hcraeser ,noitacude rof spihsrentrap niatniam dna esivitnecnI
.senilediug evitceffe-tsoc hguorht tsurt remotsuc gninrae ni sessenisub llams troppuS
.evitcirtser ylrevo ro depolevedrednu ton era skrowemarf lagel dna seicilop ytirucesrebyc taht erusnE

:ytirucesrebyc ni tnemtsevni lufsseccus erusne ot snoitadnemmocer ycilop eerht sesoporp feirb ycilop sihT .tnemtsevni hcus fo ssenevitceffe eht tlah nac hcihw ,ssenerawa cilbup tneiciffusni dna ,segatrohs lliks ,seicilop tcirts ro tnetsixeni fo mrof elbignatni eht ni tneserp era segnellahc ,)NAESA( snoitaN naisA tsaehtuoS fo noitaicossA eht ni worg ot detrats sah ytirucesrebyc ni tnemtsevni sA .skcatta decnavda erom etapicitna dna ymonoce elbaniatsus dna latigid eht fo htworg eht eruces pleh ot ytirucesrebyc edivorp ot dedeen si tnemtsevnI .esaercni ot detcejorp si dna srallod )SU( setatS detinU fo snoillim dehcaer sah skcattarebyc fo tsoc eht ,ymonoce latigid eht fo stcepsorp elbakramer eht etipseD .skcattarebyc fo ksir eht htiw semoc ygolonhcet decnavda fo noitpoda ehT tnemrewopmE namuH dna seiciloP ytirucesrebyC hguorht erutuF latigiD s™€âNAESA gniretsoF tnemrewopmE namuH dna seiciloP ytirucesrebyC hguorht erutuF latigiD s™€âNAESA gniretsoF";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-05-15 13:16:58";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-05-15 13:27:48";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"20";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}}s:1:"g";a:0:{}s:1:"e";O:8:"DateTime":3:{s:4:"date";s:26:"2023-05-22 12:13:01.004563";s:13:"timezone_type";i:3;s:8:"timezone";s:13:"Europe/Berlin";}s:1:"m";N;s:1:"c";N;}
